meanings.definition: In a sneaky or deceitful manner.
meanings.sent1: She moved snakily through the crowd, trying not to be noticed.
meanings.sent2: The thief snakily slipped the wallet out of the pocket.
meanings.sent3: The cat snakily stole a piece of fish from the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: His words slithered snakily into her mind, planting doubt.
meanings.sent5: The fog snakily crept over the city, hiding everything in its path.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of a snake, such as being sly or cunning.
meanings.sent1: The snakily politician always had a hidden agenda.
meanings.sent2: Her snakily smile made him suspicious of her true intentions.
meanings.sent3: The snakily fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The snakily path led them through the maze of trees.
meanings.sent5: His snakily eyes seemed to see through all her lies.
